meanings.definition: relating to or located near the axis
meanings.sent1: The axal line runs straight through the center.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the axal tilt of the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The axal ruler always points to the middle of the page.
meanings.sent4: Her axal focus on the main idea helped her write a clear essay.
meanings.sent5: The axal position of the flagpole made it easy to spot from afar.

meanings.definition: a type of joint in the human body
meanings.sent1: His axal was sore after playing basketball.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her axal for any signs of injury.
meanings.sent3: The axal in his knee made a creaking sound when he walked.
meanings.sent4: The axal between the bones allowed for smooth movement.
meanings.sent5: She felt a sharp pain in her axal when she twisted her ankle.

meanings.definition: a type of bone in the human body
meanings.sent1: The axal was fractured in the accident.
meanings.sent2: The axal provides structure and support for the body.
meanings.sent3: The axal in his arm felt strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent4: The axal is connected to the wrist bone.
meanings.sent5: She felt a dull ache in her axal after lifting heavy boxes.

meanings.definition: a type of ligament in the human body
meanings.sent1: The axal was stretched during the workout.
meanings.sent2: The axal connects the bones and stabilizes the joint.
meanings.sent3: The axal in her ankle felt tight after running.
meanings.sent4: The axal injury required physical therapy to heal.
meanings.sent5: She felt a twinge in her axal when she twisted her wrist.
